title: Sperm chromatin maturation assay kit
short_desc: During spermatogenesis, sperm chromatin undergoes structural changes and results in a high condensation. This nuclear compaction would be useful as a predictor of sperm fertilization capacity and pregnancy outcome
p1: Matured sperm is red.
p2: Unmatured sperm is dark violet to blue.
desc:
Routine semen analysis is the basic analysis in the exploration of male infertility. It provides useful data concerning sperm count, sperm motility and viability, sperm morphology, performance of genital glands, and ejaculation. Although, the contribution of the semen analysis is limited on the assessment of some important criteria implicated in the sperm functional potential. In fact, it is well established that the maturity of sperm chromatin is essential for fertilizing capacity of spermatozoa and embryonic development.

The maturity of sperm chromatin is essential for fertilizing capacity of spermatozoa and embryonic development Aniline blue (AB) test evaluates the degree of sperm chromatin compaction or maturation, and it is able to detect sperm chromatin defects related to their nucleoprotein content. This method allows discriminating between the presence of lysine-rich histones and arginine- and cysteine-rich protamine in sperm nuclei. Consequently, histone-rich nuclei of immature sperm will take up the blue stain whereas mature protamine-rich nuclei remain unstained.
tags: SCMA KIT

title: DNA Fragmentation Assay Kit
short_desc: SDFA is an in vitro diagnostic kit that allows the measurement of DNA fragmentation in a fast, easy, and reproducible manner, without the need for complex laboratory equipment. SDFA allows for an improved evaluation of sperm quality, complementing the information offered by the conventional sperm analysis. Conventional semen analysis only studies spermatozoa concentration, motility and morphology.
p1: Fresh semen samples should be collected in a sterile container..
p2: The sperm DNA fragmentation assay should be performed. fresh semen is needed.
desc:
The single goal of the spermatozoon is to deliver the paternal counterpart of genetic material to the oocyte.
When one refers to the sperm as a whole functional cell, it is not just for its role as a carrier but for its contents as well.
Subfertility affects between 15% – 25% of couples. Approximately 20% of infertile couples, the male partner is the sole cause. Male infertility can be due to a variety of conditions.
DNA integrity was recognized as a significant sperm functional parameter with an important role in human ART.
That unique chromatin structure protects father's genome from external influences enabling its correct transfer towards oocyte.

Sperm DNA integrity balanced with other semen parameters provides clinicians with important information to help select the most appropriate therapy for the couple.Sperm DNA fragmentation can often be improved, typically with simple lifestyle changes, such as quitting smoking, decreasing excess body weight, or having more frequent intercourse. Testing sperm DNA fragmentation proactively allows couples to address and resolve issues on their own, potentially saving time, money, and energy all of which are often in short supply for fertility patients as well as improving outcomes for both the parents and the child. Sperm sample

title: Sperm Vitality Assay Kit
short_desc: VITALITY ASSAY KIT allows the evaluation of the quality of the sperm membrane and the differentiation between live spermatozoa (intact membranes) and dead ones (affected membranes)

p2: Semen samples should be collected in a sterile container. The staining sperms should be performed. Fresh sample is needed.
desc:
Clinical evaluation sperm survival is through detecting the integrity of the sperm membrane.
This kit can be routinely detected the survival rate of all sperm specimen. By dye resist staining method to identify cell membrane integrity of sperm, so as to arrive at the percentage of live sperm.
Dye resisting staining technology principle is relevant based on the damage to the cell membrane, For example, a membrane in a non-live (dead) cells, allowing non penetrate the membrane dye can enter the membrane staining.
Assessment the vitality of a sperm sample. Nigrosin increases the contrast between the background and sperm heads, making the sperm easier to visualize. Eosin stains only the dead sperm, turning them a dark pink, Whereas live sperm appears white. This staining technique must be performed Immediately after collection and liquefaction.

title: Vitrification Straw Cryoteb
short_desc: Cryoteb is the Embryo / Oocyte vitrification device and used for storage of vitrified oocytes and embryos.
p1: Long handle model
p2: The word “vitrification” comes from the Latin term for glass, vitrum.
desc:
In the context of freezing eggs and embryos, vitrification is the process of freezing so rapidly that that the water molecules don’t have time to form ice crystals, and instead instantaneously solidify into a glass-like structure. Invitro fertilization rate depend on vitrification methods and techniques a lot.
Vitrification is a method in which not only cells but also the whole solution is solidified without the crystallization of ice. The vitrification method has advantages over the slow freezing method.
Injuries related to ice is less likely to occur, embryo survival is more likely if the embryo treatment is optimized, and embryos can be cryopreserved by a simple method in a short time and cost effective without a programed freezer.
Cryopreservation of human oocytes and embryos or blastocyts is an important choice in assisted reproductive treatment that leads to an increased cumulative outcome while decreasing other attempts’ costs.
tags: VITRIFICATION STRAW

OVIDREL® (choriogonadotropin alfa for injection) is a recombinant human chorionic gonadotropin (r-hCG) medication used for the induction of final follicular maturation and early luteinization in women undergoing assisted reproductive technologies (ART). This highly purified preparation provides precise dosing and consistent biological activity for optimal clinical outcomes.

  • Standardized 250 mcg (6,500 IU) pre-filled syringe
  • Ready-to-use formulation requiring no reconstitution

  • Pharmaceutical-grade preparation
  • FDA approved for clinical use

Technical Specifications:

Parameter Specification
Active Ingredient Choriogonadotropin alfa (recombinant hCG)
Strength 250 mcg (6,500 IU)
Formulation Pre-filled syringe with sterile solution
Route of Administration Subcutaneous injection
Manufacturing Process Recombinant DNA technology
Storage Conditions 2-8°C (refrigerated)
Shelf Life 24 months from date of manufacture

Clinical Applications:

  • Triggering of final follicular maturation and ovulation
  • Induction of luteinization after stimulation of follicular growth
  • Timing of oocyte retrieval in IVF/ICSI protocols
  • Support of luteal phase in some ART protocols
  • Part of ovulation induction protocols in infertility treatment

Key Clinical Benefits:

  • Precise, standardized dosing for consistent results
  • Recombinant production ensures high purity
  • Eliminates batch-to-batch variation seen in urinary-derived products
  • Reduced risk of contamination with human proteins
  • Convenient pre-filled syringe format improves administration accuracy
  • Well-established safety and efficacy profile

Administration Guidelines:

  1. Administer one pre-filled syringe (250 mcg) subcutaneously
  2. Timing is critical - follow specific protocol instructions
  3. Typically administered 24-36 hours prior to planned oocyte retrieval
  4. Rotate injection sites if multiple injections are required
  5. Discard syringe after single use

Important Safety Information:

  • Prescription medication - to be used under medical supervision only
  • Not for use in patients with primary ovarian failure
  • Risk of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS)
  • Potential for multiple births when used for ovulation induction
  • Contraindicated in pregnancy and in patients with hypersensitivity to hCG
  • Refer to full prescribing information for complete safety details

Storage and Handling:

  • Store in refrigerator (2-8°C/36-46°F)
  • Protect from light
  • Can be stored at room temperature (up to 25°C/77°F) for up to 30 days
  • Do not freeze
  • Keep in original packaging until time of use

short_desc: Complete vitrification system specifically formulated for ultra-rapid freezing of blastocyst stage embryos with high post-thaw survival rates.

p2: Specialized formulations for both vitrification and warming procedures
desc:
The Blastocyst Vitrification Kit provides a complete system specifically formulated for the ultra-rapid freezing of blastocyst stage embryos. This comprehensive solution includes both vitrification and warming media, with optimized cryoprotectant concentrations for maximum post-warming survival and developmental potential.

Product Features:

  • Complete vitrification and warming system
  • Optimized for blastocyst stage embryos
  • Balanced cryoprotectant formulation
  • Step-wise equilibration protocol
  • Includes all required solutions

  • CE marked and FDA cleared for clinical use

Kit Contents:

Component Volume Formulation Purpose
Equilibration Solution 10 ml HEPES-buffered with 7.5% DMSO, 7.5% EG Initial cryoprotectant exposure
Vitrification Solution 10 ml HEPES-buffered with 15% DMSO, 15% EG, Sucrose Final cryoprotectant exposure
Warming Solution 1 10 ml HEPES-buffered with 1.0M Sucrose Initial cryoprotectant removal
Warming Solution 2 10 ml HEPES-buffered with 0.5M Sucrose Graduated cryoprotectant dilution
Warming Solution 3 10 ml HEPES-buffered with 0.25M Sucrose Further cryoprotectant dilution
Washing Solution 20 ml HEPES-buffered with HSA Final embryo washing

Technical Specifications:

Parameter Specification
REF Number BVK-6000
Buffer System HEPES (ambient stable)
pH 7.2-7.4
Osmolality Solution dependent (275-3000 mOsm/kg)
Protein Content Human Serum Albumin (HSA)
Cryoprotectants DMSO, Ethylene Glycol, Sucrose
Endotoxin Level < 0.10 EU/ml
Shelf Life 12 months from date of manufacture

Vitrification Protocol Summary:

  1. Equilibrate blastocysts in Equilibration Solution for 8-12 minutes
  2. Transfer to Vitrification Solution for 60-90 seconds
  3. Load onto cryodevice and plunge into liquid nitrogen
  4. Total procedure time (after equilibration): ≤ 90 seconds
  5. Maintain at -196°C for storage

Warming Protocol Summary:

  1. Warm device rapidly and immerse in Warming Solution 1 at 37°C
  2. Transfer blastocysts through Warming Solutions 1, 2, and 3 sequentially
  3. Wash in Washing Solution
  4. Return to culture medium for recovery
  5. Total procedure time: approximately 10 minutes

Clinical Applications:

  • Cryopreservation of human blastocysts
  • Freeze-all cycles
  • Preimplantation genetic testing cycles
  • Embryo banking
  • Fertility preservation
  • Elective single embryo transfer programs
  • Oocyte donation coordination

Clinical Outcomes:

  • Maintained implantation potential

  • Validated with expanded, hatching and fully hatched blastocysts
  • Compatible with artificially collapsed blastocysts
  • Demonstrated effectiveness with biopsied embryos

Solution Key Components Function

DS (Dilution Solution) 0.5M sucrose, HSA, HEPES Graduated cryoprotectant dilution

Clinical Applications:

  • Vitrification of human oocytes at MII stage
  • Vitrification of embryos at all developmental stages:
  • Pronuclear (2PN) stage embryos
  • Cleavage-stage embryos (Day 2-3)
  • Morula-stage embryos (Day 4)
  • Blastocyst-stage embryos (Day 5-7)
  • Compatible with all major vitrification carrier devices
  • Suitable for oocyte banking programs
  • Optimized for freeze-all strategies
  • Validated for PGT workflows

Vitrification Protocol Overview:

  • Warm all solutions to room temperature (20-27°C)
  • Label cryostorage devices and prepare liquid nitrogen
  • Transfer specimen to ES for 6-10 minutes
  • Transfer to VS for 30-60 seconds
  • Load onto vitrification carrier within 30 seconds
  • Plunge directly into liquid nitrogen
  • Transfer to long-term storage container

Warming Protocol Overview:

  • Warm TS to 37°C, other solutions to room temperature
  • Quickly transfer vitrification device from storage to warming solution
  • Immerse specimen in TS for 1 minute at 37°C
  • Transfer to DS for 3 minutes at room temperature
  • Transfer to WS for 5 minutes at room temperature
  • Transfer to culture medium for recovery

Clinical Benefits:

  • Excellent developmental potential after warming

Usage Protocol - Density Gradient:

  • Warm medium and density gradient solutions to 37°C
  • Layer density gradient media in a conical tube
  • Gently overlay liquefied semen sample
  • Centrifuge according to laboratory protocol
  • Carefully remove supernatant and isolate pellet
  • Resuspend pellet in fresh medium
  • Perform washing centrifugation steps
  • Adjust final concentration for insemination or ICSI

Usage Protocol - Swim-Up:

  • Warm medium to 37°C prior to use
  • Place liquefied semen in conical tube
  • Gently layer medium over semen
  • Incubate at a 45° angle at 37°C for 30-60 minutes
  • Carefully collect upper medium containing motile sperm
  • Perform washing centrifugation if required
  • Adjust final concentration for insemination or ICSI

Clinical Applications:

  • Preparation of donor sperm samples

Density Gradient Protocol (Overview):

  • Warm medium to 37°C prior to use
  • Layer density gradient media in conical tube
  • Gently layer liquefied semen on top
  • Centrifuge at 300-400g for 15-20 minutes
  • Remove supernatant and transfer pellet to clean tube
  • Add 2-3ml of fresh medium and resuspend
  • Centrifuge at 200g for 8-10 minutes
  • Resuspend final pellet in appropriate volume
  • Assess concentration and motility

Swim-Up Protocol (Overview):

  • Warm medium to 37°C prior to use
  • Place 0.5-1.0ml of liquefied semen in conical tube
  • Gently layer 1-2ml of medium on top
  • Incubate at 45° angle at 37°C for 30-60 minutes
  • Carefully aspirate the top 0.5-1.0ml
  • Transfer to clean tube with fresh medium
  • Centrifuge at 200g for 8-10 minutes
  • Resuspend final pellet in appropriate volume
  • Assess concentration and motility

Workflow Integration:

  • Compatible with all standard sperm preparation methods
  • Optimal for both gradient and swim-up techniques
  • Ambient temperature stability for processing

title: Hyaluronan Binding Assay
short_desc: Advanced diagnostic test for evaluating sperm maturity and functionality by assessing the ability of sperm to bind to hyaluronic acid, a key indicator of sperm selection capability.
p1: The CELLVU® HYDAK® HBA test provides clinically relevant information about sperm quality that correlates with successful fertilization outcomes in assisted reproductive procedures.
p2: This innovative assay helps embryologists select the most functionally mature sperm for ICSI procedures, potentially improving fertilization rates and embryo development.
desc:
Product Overview

The CELLVU® HYDAK® HBA (Hyaluronan Binding Assay) is a specialized diagnostic tool that assesses sperm maturity by measuring the sperm's ability to bind to hyaluronic acid, which is a natural selector of functionally mature sperm with high DNA integrity.

Clinical Significance

  • Mature sperm with intact DNA bind to hyaluronan, which is the main component of the cumulus oophorus surrounding the oocyte
  • Binding ability correlates with decreased chromosomal abnormalities
  • Helps identify sperm with lower rates of DNA fragmentation
  • Assists in selection of optimal sperm for ICSI procedures
  • May improve fertilization rates and embryo quality

Kit Components

ComponentQuantityFunction
HYDAK® Slides5 slidesHyaluronan-coated chambers for binding assessment
Control Chamber1 per slideReference for comparison
Protocol Guide1Detailed step-by-step instructions
Analysis Grid1Standardized counting template

Test Procedure

  1. Add prepared sperm sample to test chamber
  2. Incubate for prescribed time period
  3. Observe sperm binding under microscope
  4. Count bound vs. unbound sperm
  5. Calculate binding percentage

Interpretation

  • ≥80% binding: Excellent sperm maturity
  • 60-80% binding: Good sperm maturity
  • ≤60% binding: Decreased functional maturity, may indicate need for advanced sperm selection

Storage and Stability

Store kit at 2-8°C. Do not freeze. Stable until expiration date when stored as directed. Each slide is individually sealed to maintain integrity.


Quality Control

Each batch undergoes rigorous quality control testing to ensure consistent performance and reliability. Certificates of analysis available upon request.
tags: Sperm analysis, Hyaluronan binding, HBA, Sperm selection, ICSI preparation

The SZX16 incorporates Olympus' advanced ComfortView ergonomic design to reduce fatigue during extended observation sessions. The parallel optical path ensures natural stereoscopic viewing without eye strain, while the sophisticated LED illumination system provides bright, uniform lighting with long operational life. The system's modularity allows for customization to specific application requirements, with options ranging from standard laboratory setups to specialized industrial inspection configurations. With its exceptional optical performance and versatility, the SZX16 is particularly valuable for applications requiring detailed examination of larger specimens, including developmental biology, entomology, botany, material science, electronics inspection, and forensic analysis.
